thread.title: Homecoming parade haunts downtown Forest Grove (photos)
thread.title_full: Homecoming parade haunts downtown Forest Grove (photos) | OregonLive.com

author: Dillon Pilorget | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Homecoming parade haunts downtown Forest Grove (photos)
text:
Halloween came a week and a day early when Forest Grove High School's homecoming parade crawled from the grave and into the city's downtown streets.
Cheerleaders carried pumpkin candy buckets, the marching band played "This is Halloween" from "The Nightmare Before Christmas," and the Drama Club dressed as the coolest ghouls in school, each getting into the monster spirit for the "Haunted Homecoming" theme.
And of course, as in any good parade or Halloween celebration, there was plenty of candy to be had, without even having to say "trick or treat." And there were even a few kids clad in their halloween costumes, ready to receive it.
After the jack-o'-lanterns are lit later in the evening, the Forest Grove Vikings football team will go on to face Salem's McKay High School at 7:15 p.m.
-- Dillon Pilorget
dpilorget@oregonian.com
